Those were good years man.

Laar

Me neither, we don't celebrate Halloween in Holland nor should we
In the southern part we do have something similar called Carneval though, in febraury, coolest suit for that... Ok, never really celebrated that much either, but I guess my Rambo suit

On october 9, 2012
CornDuck

My brother made a cool outfit for me when I was a kid.

Basically it was a scarecrow on my back, and had wood dowels connected to its wrists. The dowels were connected to my elbows and wrists, and when I moved my arms backwards, the scarecrows arms moved out (extended) and held the bag for them to drop the candy into. If I moved my hands up and down, the bag moved up and down expectantly like most kids do.

So I walked up to the door and ring the bell, turned around and yelled "trick or treat", held out the arms until I felt the bag move when they put the candy inside. Then I turn around and say "Caw-Caw". I was wearing a crow mask on my face.

I wish I had pictures of it, that was 40 years ago.

Day 127:
What is one item you own that you couldn't live without?
On november 21, 2012
CornDuck

I had to really think about all the junk I own. What one item would I truly miss?

A friend of mine, when we were maybe 10, gave me a dummy 20mm Vulcan Aircraft Cannon round. The case is drilled out and the primer was killed.

He had tried to pry the bullet out of the casing, so it is loose but still crimped in. It wont pull out.

When you twist it, an extremely loud squeaking "CHIRP" comes out of it.
I mean LOUD. You need earplugs or it really hurts the ears.
Over the years Ive discovered it mimics ground squirrels so well I can bring them up with one twist.
Coyotes and Fox will come in to it as well.

I've been offered hundreds of dollars for it from more than one varmint hunter after they see how well it works.
I will never give it up.
On november 21, 2012
Afreet

There is no such kind of item

On january 22, 2013
CornDuck

I like spicy food, but like Loxagon said there has to be flavor or its a waste of peppers. I eat a local chili-mango candy that is made with Habenero peppers. The stuff made with cayenne pales by comparison.

The hottest I ever ate was a homegrown Thai pepper. I thought they were small Jalepeno, I didnt know my wife planted Thai's.
One bite and instantly my mouth was on fire, there was NO creep up and burn, it was instant.
After they turned red they were uneatable, yeah I tried and paid dearly. Good in a 55-gallon barrel of soup maybe, they make Habeneros seem cold.

Ive had Ghost peppers offered at a Farmers Market but Im not that interested after watching several videos online. I can eat Habeneros pretty easy, can suffer a Thai, but those Ghosts are murder weapons.
